svg.title: Energy to remove the first electron
svg.desc:
Energy required to remove the first electron from an atom.
Originally, the ionization energy data is from http://www.science.co.il/PTelements.asp?s=ionization
The graph is derived from
Wikpedia Commons, User:Sponk, http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Erste_Ionisierungsenergie_PSE_color_coded.png
German Wikipedia, User:JJnoDog, http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Datei:IonizationEnergyAtomicWeight.PNG http://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:IonizationEnergyAtomicWeight.PNG
See also Raymond Chang, Chemistry, 2nd edition, Random House, 1984, page 166
Unlike above figures, the elements are not joined with line segments because the data is discrete. Lines are drawn from the abscissa to the noble gases to signal the end of a periodic table row.
2016-11-09 en:User:DePiep: Added elements 104 - 108. All ionisation energy values are read from NIST https://www.nist.gov/sites/default/files/illo_for_2014_pt_1.png Categories and their color legend now follow the 2013 enwiki-scheme (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Periodic_table#Overview ). Changes: - Added: categories 'diatomic nonmetal' "#e7ff8f", and 'polyatomic nonmetal' "#a1ffc3". - Deprecated: 'nonmetal' "#a0ffa0", 'halogen "#ffff99".
Todo: check/add translations for 'diatomic nonmetal' and 'polyatomic nonmetal'.
